results.title: Dose response for blood pressure and degree of cardiac beta-blockade with atenolol.

results.title: Relationship between blood level of atenolol and pharmacologic effect.
results.text_hl: The degree of @<m>DISEASE_Delayed_Emergence_from_Anesthesia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D055191 @@@beta blockade@@@ was assessed by measuring maximum-exercise @DISEASE_Tachycardia @DISEASE_MESH:D013610 @@@tachycardia@@@ and was correlated with the blood level of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Amery A, De Plaen JF, Lijnen P, McAinsh J, Reybrouck T. Relationship between blood level of atenolol and pharmacologic effect. Clin Pharmacol Ther. 1977 Jun;21(6):691-9. PMID: 324694
citations.BibTeX: @article{324694, title={Relationship between blood level of atenolol and pharmacologic effect.}, author={Amery A and De Plaen JF and Lijnen P and McAinsh J and Reybrouck T}, journal={Clin Pharmacol Ther}, volume={21}, number={6}, pages={691-9}}

results.title: Bronchial and cardiac beta-adrenoceptor blockade--a comparison of atenolol, acebutolol and labetalol.
results.text_hl: Bronchial @<m>DISEASE_Delayed_Emergence_from_Anesthesia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D055191 @@@beta-adrenoceptor blockade@@@ was assessed after each drug as the dose of @CHEMICAL_Albuterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000420 @@@salbutamol@@@ needed to cause a 50% increase in sGaw (sGaw D50). 3 Cardiac @<m>DISEASE_Delayed_Emergence_from_Anesthesia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D055191 @@@beta-adrenoceptor blockade@@@ was assessed after the same doses of each beta-adrenoceptor antagonist, by measuring the percentage reduction in exercise heart rate from control, after exercise for 5 min at 70% of the subject's maximum work rate. 4 @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ 50 and 100 mg caused least bronchial @<m>DISEASE_Delayed_Emergence_from_Anesthesia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D055191 @@@beta-adrenoceptor blockade@@@ and the greatest reduction in exercise heart rate. 5 @CHEMICAL_Acebutolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000070 @@@Acebutolol@@@ 100 and 200 mg and @CHEMICAL_Labetalol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007741 @@@labetalol@@@ 150 and 300 mg produced more bronchial @<m>DISEASE_Delayed_Emergence_from_Anesthesia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D055191 @@@beta-adrenoceptor blockade@@@ than @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@. 6 With this approach new beta-adrenoceptor antagonists can be assessed without putting @DISEASE_Status_Asthmaticus @DISEASE_MESH:D013224 @@@asthmatic@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ at risk.

citations.NLM: Gribbin HR, Mackay AD, Baldwin CJ, Tattersfield AE. Bronchial and cardiac beta-adrenoceptor blockade--a comparison of atenolol, acebutolol and labetalol. Br J Clin Pharmacol. 1981 Jul;12(1):61-5. PMID: 6264936
citations.BibTeX: @article{6264936, title={Bronchial and cardiac beta-adrenoceptor blockade--a comparison of atenolol, acebutolol and labetalol.}, author={Gribbin HR and Mackay AD and Baldwin CJ and Tattersfield AE}, journal={Br J Clin Pharmacol}, volume={12}, number={1}, pages={61-5}}

results.title: Subjective symptoms and pharmacokinetics/dynamics of metoprolol CR in elderly subjects--a comparison with atenolol.
results.text_hl: Four hours after dose intake, the degree of beta @<m>DISEASE_Delayed_Emergence_from_Anesthesia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D055191 @@@1-blockade@@@ was significantly greater with conventional @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ 50 mg than with either dose of @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@ CR.

citations.NLM: Dimenäs ES, Dahlöf CG, Heibel B, Moore RG, Olofsson BK, Westergren GE, Lücker PW. Subjective symptoms and pharmacokinetics/dynamics of metoprolol CR in elderly subjects--a comparison with atenolol. Eur J Clin Pharmacol. 1990;38(6):571-8. PMID: 2373131
citations.BibTeX: @article{2373131, title={Subjective symptoms and pharmacokinetics/dynamics of metoprolol CR in elderly subjects--a comparison with atenolol.}, author={Dimenäs ES and Dahlöf CG and Heibel B and Moore RG and Olofsson BK and Westergren GE and Lücker PW}, journal={Eur J Clin Pharmacol}, volume={38}, number={6}, pages={571-8}}

results.title: Reduction of exercise tachycardia in man after propranolol, atenolol and bisoprolol in comparison to beta-adrenoceptor occupancy.
results.text_hl: Exercise @DISEASE_Tachycardia @DISEASE_MESH:D013610 @@@tachycardia@@@ was monitored for 84 hours after administration of the drugs to monitor @<m>DISEASE_Delayed_Emergence_from_Anesthesia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D055191 @@@beta blockade@@@ in vivo.

results.title: Atenolol administered once daily in primary hypertension. Effects on blood pressure in relation to pre-treatment plasma renin activity.
results.text_hl: Exercise tests, performed in 10 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@, showed the same degree of partial @<m>DISEASE_Delayed_Emergence_from_Anesthesia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D055191 @@@beta-blockade@@@ 24 hours after intake of 100 and 200 mg @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.
